update.description:
This is just a proof of concept at the moment. It seems like the most straightforward way to get the RTF displayed in the corner of the screen as part of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31).

‌

It requires a change in ignition rendering to allow a visual to be attached to a camera: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86)

I am yet to make it robust to the dimensions of the camera though.

content.raw: Minor nit, but if there are say 4 cameras attached to a scene, then we’ll get this message 3 times.  It might be better to just set a flag here and only print it once at the end if we’ve seen more than one.
content.html: Minor nit, but if there are say 4 cameras attached to a scene, then we’ll get this message 3 times. It might be better to just set a flag here and only print it once at the end if we’ve seen more than one.

pull_request.title: Realtime factor display plugin: Attach RTF text to Camera of the Scene

pullrequest.title: Realtime factor display plugin: Attach RTF text to Camera of the Scene

content.raw:
I switched to using a timer in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/55df1c5d24b5786d89a3e57f81daa4bd32e97f2a?at=default](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/55df1c5d24b5786d89a3e57f81daa4bd32e97f2a?at=default). it’s low frequency because it doesn’t need to be very fast to respond to image resizes.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3837963032-RealtimeFactorDisplay_overlay_timer.gif)
‌

Calling UpdateTextPose is necessary when the image is resized, and also when the plugin first loads. Just after the Scene3D’s camera is created, a resize event is called, where the camera properties are set to match what is present in the Scene3D widget. Without the timer, the text doesn’t get positioned correctly on startup of the RealtimeFactorDisplay plugin.

This is what happens on startup with one camera, if UpdateTextPose is only called once from the display plugin’s initialisation:

`In Scene3d load. Camera dimensions: 640, 480`

`In Scene3d load: Camera aspect ratio: 1.33333`

`UpdateTextPose using camera dimensions: 640, 480`

`UpdateTextPose using camera aspect ratio: 1.33333`

`In Scene3d resize event. Camera dimensions: 640, 480`

`In Scene3d resize event. Camera aspect ratio: 1.01144`

The values after the resize event are the correct values. I’ll add a comment explaining that the timer works around this.
content.html:
I switched to using a timer in #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/55df1c5d24b5786d89a3e57f81daa4bd32e97f2a?at=default. it’s low frequency because it doesn’t need to be very fast to respond to image resizes.

‌

Calling UpdateTextPose is necessary when the image is resized, and also when the plugin first loads. Just after the Scene3D’s camera is created, a resize event is called, where the camera properties are set to match what is present in the Scene3D widget. Without the timer, the text doesn’t get positioned correctly on startup of the RealtimeFactorDisplay plugin.

This is what happens on startup with one camera, if UpdateTextPose is only called once from the display plugin’s initialisation:

In Scene3d load. Camera dimensions: 640, 480

In Scene3d load: Camera aspect ratio: 1.33333

UpdateTextPose using camera dimensions: 640, 480

UpdateTextPose using camera aspect ratio: 1.33333

In Scene3d resize event. Camera dimensions: 640, 480

In Scene3d resize event. Camera aspect ratio: 1.01144

The values after the resize event are the correct values. I’ll add a comment explaining that the timer works around this.

update.description:
This is just a proof of concept at the moment. It seems like the most straightforward way to get the RTF displayed in the corner of the screen as part of [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31).

‌

It requires a change in ignition rendering to allow a visual to be attached to a camera: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/86)

I am yet to make it robust to the dimensions of the camera though.
update.title: Realtime factor display plugin: Attach RTF text to Camera of the Scene

pull_request.title: Realtime factor display plugin: Attach RTF text to Camera of the Scene

pullrequest.title: Realtime factor display plugin: Attach RTF text to Camera of the Scene

content.raw:
Ready for review please. Requires [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/88](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/88) which is still under review but the direction has been approved.

Here’s a demo of the RTF display in the example config, though the RTF display doesn’t currently make sense in the demo config because nothing is publishing the RTF.

_The gif was created with a simulation publishing the RTF independently, just to pump the update callback to re-calculate on window resize_.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1674502324-RealtimeFactorDisplay_overlay.gif)
The text will be attached to the camera, so it will be re-positioned based on the camera’s change in pose automatically from panning or zooming. It will _not_ automatically reposition the text when the camera is resized. It is _not_ responding to camera resize events directly, it is just being updated whenever a RTF message is received, which is why there is a little big of lag between camera resize and the text recalculation.  
  
The text is positioned in the bottom left because I right alignment didn’t seem to be working.

‌

The text position relative to the camera is calculated via back projection from the bottom left corner of the image plane into camera 3D coordinates, using its projection matrix. [These calculations are followed](http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/image_geometry/html/c++/pinhole__camera__model_8cpp_source.html#l00282), from PinholeCameraModel::projectPixelTo3dRay in image\_geometry ros package \(though the equations for back-projection are generally well established, but that’s the specific code I followed\).

‌

Because the projection matrix is used, this works with other cameras as well. I’ve tested with a camera with `IGN_DTOR(60));` also and it works. There are still a few magic numbers in the calculations though that probably have equations associated with them, but I determined them empirically.
content.html:
Ready for review please. Requires #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/88 which is still under review but the direction has been approved.

Here’s a demo of the RTF display in the example config, though the RTF display doesn’t currently make sense in the demo config because nothing is publishing the RTF.

The gif was created with a simulation publishing the RTF independently, just to pump the update callback to re-calculate on window resize.

The text will be attached to the camera, so it will be re-positioned based on the camera’s change in pose automatically from panning or zooming. It will not automatically reposition the text when the camera is resized. It is not responding to camera resize events directly, it is just being updated whenever a RTF message is received, which is why there is a little big of lag between camera resize and the text recalculation.

The text is positioned in the bottom left because I right alignment didn’t seem to be working.

‌

The text position relative to the camera is calculated via back projection from the bottom left corner of the image plane into camera 3D coordinates, using its projection matrix. These calculations are followed, from PinholeCameraModel::projectPixelTo3dRay in image_geometry ros package (though the equations for back-projection are generally well established, but that’s the specific code I followed).

‌

Because the projection matrix is used, this works with other cameras as well. I’ve tested with a camera with IGN_DTOR(60)); also and it works. There are still a few magic numbers in the calculations though that probably have equations associated with them, but I determined them empirically.
